title: cmd/gc: improve "use of package not in selector"
body:
If one uses a package identifier without specifying an item in the package, the error
returned is "use of package foo not in selector"
(http://play.golang.org/p/Q-KDAvp9mN)

I think the wording of this error message could be improved. It can be interpreted as
"use of a package that is not in the selector" which makes it sound like the
package hasn't been imported (or something). A simple rewording to improve clarity could
be "use of package foo without selector". This makes it clear the problem is
with how the package is being used, and not a problem with the package itself.
